H0.text: Fungi only is the taxonomic group in which the cell could be classified, because its ribosomes are smaller than those found in plants.

H1.text: Archaea only are the taxonomic group in which a cell whose ribosomes are smaller than those found in plants could be classified.

H2.text: Bacteria or archaea are the taxonomic groups in which a cell with ribosomes smaller than those found in plants could be classified.

H3.text: Bacteria or fungi are taxonomic groups in which a cell with ribosomes smaller than those found in plants could be classified.

A4.text: Prokaryotic ribosomes are around 20 nm (200 Å) in diameter and are composed of 65% rRNA and 35% ribosomal proteins. Eukaryotic ribosomes are between 25 and 30 nm (250–300 Å) in diameter with an rRNA-to-protein ratio that is close to 1.

A5.text: Eukaryotes have 80S ribosomes located in their cytosol, each consisting of a small (40S) and large (60S) subunit.
